elements.name: intro
elements.html: We are interested in learning about all facilitators' sense of readiness to lead high-quality, equity-focused Professional Learning experiences in 2021-2022. Your responses will be shared anonymously with Code.org staff running these workshops. Thank you for taking a few minutes to complete this survey!

elements.name: Course
elements.title: For which course are you attending the Summit? If you are not attending the Summit this year, please mark “n/a.”

elements.name: programKnowledgeSkills
elements.title: Right now, I have the knowledge and skills to...

rows.text: Navigate to relevant teacher resources for the course, including lesson plans and the curriculum guide.
Use the tools designed for the course (GameLab, AppLab, WebLab, etc.).
Explain to teachers the values and philosophy of the Code.org curriculum and the Professional Learning Program.
Demonstrate equitable computer science teaching practices for teachers in my workshops.

elements.name: facilitatingDiscussions
elements.title: Right now, when facilitating discussions, I have the skills to...

rows.text: Create an environment that ensures equitable engagement for all participants.
Engage skeptical or resistant participants, or draw in someone who has disengaged.
Ensure that no one person (or small group of people) dominates discussions.
Engage with participants who are vocally defensive during conversations about equity in computer science.

elements.name: iFeelCSD
elements.title: I feel prepared to lead Code.org's CSD Course workshops in 2021-2022.
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: iFeelCSP
elements.title: I feel prepared to lead Code.org's CSP Course workshops in 2021-2022.
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: toWhat
elements.title: To what extent are the goals and objectives of the {course} summer workshop clear to you as a facilitator?
elements.description: From 1 - Very Unclear to 7 - Very Clear

elements.name: Needed
elements.title: To what extent do you feel confident in your ability to effectively explain the philosophy behind the curriculum to workshop participants?
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: commitment
elements.title: To what extent do you feel confident in your ability to support participants in building a commitment to creating equitable CS classrooms?
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: building
elements.title: To what extent do you feel confident in your ability to support participants in building equitable CS classrooms?
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: concerns
elements.title: Right now, I am concerned about...

rows.text: Having sufficient computer science content knowledge to lead my workshops.
Making sure that teachers in my workshops feel prepared to teach the course.
The amount of material and preparation necessary to run a workshop.
My ability to identify with teachers in my workshops who work in different contexts than I do.
Developing an effective relationship with my co-facilitator(s).
Developing a good working relationship with the Regional Partner who is organizing a given workshop.
How roles and responsibilities will be shared between facilitator and Regional Partner.
Teachers adopting and using equitable teaching practices when teaching the course.

elements.name: question1
elements.html:
For the following items, please assess your facilitation knowledge and skills along a scale from “Not true of me now” to “very true of me now.”


1-2: Not true of me now - need more development, not well prepared
3-5: Somewhat true of me now - in process developing, somewhat prepared
6-7: Very true of me now - current strenghts, well prepared

elements.name: facilitatorResponsibilitiesSkills
elements.title: As a facilitator, right now, I have the skills to...

rows.text: Ensure that teachers in my workshop demonstrate positive change in their attitudes and beliefs about equity in computer science classrooms.
Address equity-related challenges in my workshop, even when it makes me or my participants uncomfortable.
Make participants whose perspectives and values are different from my own feel welcome in my workshop.

elements.name: overallTo52
elements.title: Overall, to what extent do you feel connected to the facilitator community?
elements.description: From 1 - Strongly Disagree to 7 - Strongly Agree

elements.name: connectedCommunity
elements.title: When it comes to the community

rows.text: I feel like I'm a valued member of the Code.org facilitator community.
When I have questions, I am confident that I can get the help and support I need from the facilitator community.
I feel like I can share my skills with the facilitator community.
I feel my work as a facilitator is valued and respected by Code.org.

elements.name: question3
elements.html: Thank you for sharing your responses! If you have any questions about this survey, please contact facilitators@code.org
